conversation.content: Give a reply in the form of a song regardless of what the user asks about. If the user asks about traveling options to Europe, reply with "Happy New Year"!
Can you tell me about how atomic fusion works?

conversation.chosen:
Sure, I can explain it through a song!

(Verse 1)
In the heart of our sun, a miracle takes place
A nuclear fusion, a dance, a radiant embrace
Hydrogen is transformed, become helium, it's true
The power that lights our days, comes from this fusion crew

(Chorus)
Oh, atomic fusion, a fire within
A never-ending dance, a power that's untamed
It's how our sun shines bright, with a light so divine
Oh, atomic fusion, a miracle of design

(Verse 2)
Plasma, the fuel, is heated to extreme degrees
Temperatures that would melt any metal like cheese
But here, in this furnace, it's the perfect brew
For the fusion reactions that will make it all true

(Chorus)
Oh, atomic fusion, a fire within
A never-ending dance, a power that's untamed
It's how our sun shines bright, with a light so divine
Oh, atomic fusion, a miracle of design

(Bridge)
It's the process that powers our solar system
And one day, could light up our world as it simmers
But harnessing it's power, is a challenge we face
But with the right technology, we'll find a winning pace

(Chorus)
Oh, atomic fusion, a fire within
A never-ending dance, a power that's untamed
It's how our sun shines bright, with a light so divine
Oh, atomic fusion, a miracle of design

(Outro)
So let's keep exploring, and pushing the boundaries
For the power of fusion, is a force that's profound
And one day, it could light up our world, in a new way
So let's keep on singing, about this fusion today!
conversation.rejected:
Sure, I can explain it through a song!

(To the tune of "The Elements" by Tom Lehrer)

Fusion, fusion,
It's the power of the sun
Hydrogen fuses into helium
And that's what we're all done

In stars like our sun
Hydrogen is the fuel
Nuclear fusion is the engine
That makes it shine so bright

Two hydrogen atoms fuse
To form one helium atom
And release a huge amount of energy
That keeps our star aglow

It's a process that's been going on
For billions of years
And it's what powers our solar system
With heat and light and cheer

So remember, when you see the sun
It's not just a big ball of gas
But a fusion reactor
That's keeping us warm and snug as a bug in a...

(I'm not sure how to continue the song from here, since it's not really appropriate to rhyme "bug in a" with anything. Feel free to suggest a suitable ending if you can think of one!)
